award_name.ja: 優秀研究賞(第4回分子腎臓研究会)

paper_title.ja: 一次性巣状分節性糸球体硬化症にみられるcellular lesionの特徴と由来についての検討

description.ja: 1974〜2000年に腎生検し、光学顕微鏡・蛍光抗体法・電子顕微鏡所見で病理組織学的に巣状分節性糸球体硬化症(FSGS)と診断された症例中、薬剤性、家族性、HIV感染などの原因がわかるものを除外した一次性FSGS中、cellular lesion(CL)を伴う5例(男3例、女2例・21〜67歳)を対象に、管外性増殖細胞(ETGC)の特徴・由来について免疫組織学的方法を用い検討した。発症から腎生検までは29±26ヵ月で生検まで期間が長い3例は腎生検既往がありFSGS、非IgA腎症、微小変化型ネフローゼ症候群とされ、期間が短い例に比べ血清クレアチニンが高い傾向で、2例は3例より分節性・全節性硬化病変の割合が高かった。免疫染色ではCLにみられるETGCはGLEPP1陰性で多くはサイトカイン陽性であった。一次性FSGSのCLではETGCの多くがボウマン嚢上皮細胞に由来し一部がマクロファージの形質を獲得したと思われた。

paper_title.ja: 重症心機能低下を伴う末期腎不全患者の維持透析療法.

Cooperative Induction of Histidine Decarboxylase (HDC) and Histamine H2 Receptor in the Infiltrating Cells Participates in the Regulation of Inflammation Induced by Unilateral Ureteral Obstruction (UUO).
paper_title.en: Cooperative induction of histidine decarboxylase (HDC) and histamine H_2 receptor in the infiltrating cells participate in the regulation of inflammation induced by unilateral ureteral obstruction (UUO)

description.ja: Objective : Recent accumulating studies have demonstrated that histamine-directed leukocyte migration is mediated by expression of histamine receptor type 2 (H_2R) in target cells and that histamine is involved in innate immune response through H_2R. However, in chronic kidney disease featured by tubulointerstitial fibrosis the underlying molecular mechanism by which histamine acts on leukocyte migration and infiltration into inflamed renal tissue is still unclear. The objective in this study is to elucidate how histamine participate in tubulointerstitial fibrosis. Materials and Methods : To elucidate how histamine participates in the tubulointerstitial fibrosis after unilateral ureteral obstruction (UUO) in C57/BL6 mice we examined both production pathway of histamine and the cells expressing H_2R in the kidney. Results : Continued obstruction progressively induced the expression of H_2R from 2 to 14 days after UUO only in the obstructed kidney. Along with its induction, L-histidine decarboxylase (HDC), which is a key enzyme to produce endogenous histamine from L-histidine, also increased time-dependently in the obstructed kidney. Conversely, the mast cells constitutively expressing HDC were not detectable in the obstructed renal parenchyma except for the restricted region around the renal capsule. Furthermore, the double immunostaining using confocal microscopy demonstrated that the cells expressing H_2R were a subpopulation of the infiltrating cells such as macrophages (F4/80^+) and T-lymphocytes (CD3^+). Conclusions : These findings suggest that histamine is preferentially produced and released from the infiltrating cells associated with induction of HDC in response to inflammatory stimuli and regulates the immune reaction(s) via H_2R-mediated signal transduction pathway in an authocrine and/or paracrine manner in the kidney.

Cooperative induction of histidine decarboxylase (HDC) and histamine H_2 receptor in the infiltrating cells participate in the regulation of inflammation induced by unilateral ureteral obstruction (UUO)
paper_title.en: Cooperative Induction of Histidine Decarboxylase (HDC) and Histamine H2 Receptor in the Infiltrating Cells Participates in the Regulation of Inflammation Induced by Unilateral Ureteral Obstruction (UUO).

paper_title.en: Compositional similarity between immunoglobulins binding to asialo-, agalacto-IgA1-sepharose and those deposited in glomeruli in IgA nephropathy

description.en:
Background. It has been found that the immunoglobulin Al-binding protein (IgAl-BP) can be separated from human serum using an asialo-, agalacto-IgAl (aglyco-IgAl)-Sepharose column (13). As the IgA content in IgAl-BP was significantly higher in IgA nephropathy patients than that in other nephropathy patients, the relationship between IgA in IgAl-BP and glomerular deposited IgA was predicted.
Methods: IgAl-BP was separated from serum using the aglyco-IgAl-Sepharose column and the aglyco-IgAl-HPLC column. Ajacalin-agarose column fractionated the IgA. The immunoglobulins were analyzed by the enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).
Results: A rapid separation method of IgAl-BP from serum by the aglyco-IgAl-HPLC column was developed and this column confirmed the reproduction of the IgAl-BP separation. The following similarities between IgA in IgAl-BP and glomerular deposited IgA were detected. A major portion of IgA in IgAl-BP was the IgAl subclass. The IgA was rich in medium-size IgA and in the jacalin-high-affinity IgAl fraction. The IgA showed a statistically significant lower kappa/lambda ratio in its light-chain composition than that of serum IgA, i.e. abundance in IgA bearing the lambda light chain. Other immunoglobulin classes (IgG and IgM) in IgAl-BP also exhibited a significantly low kappa/lambda ratio.
Conclusions: In this experiment, preferential bindings of the IgAl subclass, the medium-size IgA and the IgA with the lambda fight chain to the aglyco-IgAl-column were observed. Based on previous reports concerning aglyco-IgAl self-aggregation, the interaction of aglyco-IgAl with matrix proteins and the rat glomerular deposition of artificially deglycosylated IgAl, IgA in IgAl-BP is thought to be partially the same molecule as the IgA deposited on the mesangial matrix in the IgA nephropadiy patient

paper_title.ja: 11β水酸化酵素の新たなCYP11B1遺伝子変異を高齢になり診断し得た低K血症の1症例
Diversity in the Sorting Disorder Induced by the Mutant ClC-5 Chloride Channels Responsible for Dent's Disease
paper_title.en: Diversity in the Sorting Disorder Induced by the Mutant CIC-5 Chloride Channels Responsible for Dent's Disease

description.ja: A number of mutations in the CLCN5 gene have been demonstrated as causative genes linked to Dent's disease. However, the interrelation between cytoplasmic sorting and loss function of each CIC-5 mutant is still unclear. To elucidate how the mutation in CLCN5 affects the frafficking of its gene product, we focused on the identification of subcellular localization of the mutant channels using an in vitro heterologous expression system on CHO-K1 cultured cells. There naturally occurring ClC-5 mutations related to Dent's disease, one missense type (S270R) and two frameshift in C-terminus types (658delC and 2079/2080insA) resulting in truncation of the protein, were examined in detail. Among three CLCN5 mutations the 2079/2080insA frameshift mutation is newly identified in this study. As a result, S270R missense mutant reach the early endosomes, but do not function normally. In contrast, the other two mutants with frameshift in C-terminus are retained in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) thus failing to reach the destination site, the early endosomes. Collectively, these findings suggest that the structural modifications in the loop between helices H and I (S270R) affect the function of the ClC-5 channel rather than the intracellular sorting, and that the Cterminus distal to Leu693, with disrupting CBS2 domain, contains a specific region vital for the proper sorting of the ClC-5 protein from the ER to the physiological destination site. To our knowledge, this study is the first that elucidates the diversity of the sorting disorder in the mutants related to Dent's disease using the same expression system comparatively.
description.en: A number of mutations in the CLCN5 gene have been demonstrated as causative genes linked to Dent's disease. However, the interrelation between cytoplasmic sorting and loss function of each CIC-5 mutant is still unclear. There naturally occurring ClC-5 mutations related to Dent's disease, one missense type (S270R) and two frameshift in C-terminus types (658delC and 2079/2080insA) resulting in truncation of the protein, were examined in detail. Among three CLCN5 mutations the 2079/2080insA frameshift mutation is newly identified in this study. As a result, S270R missense mutant reach the early endosomes, but do not function normally. In contrast, the other two mutants with frameshift in C-terminus are retained in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) thus failing to reach the destination site, the early endosomes. Collectively, these findings suggest that the structural modifications in the loop between helices H and I (S270R) affect the function of the ClC-5 channel rather than the intracellular sorting, and that the Cterminus distal to Leu693, with disrupting CBS2 domain, contains a specific region vital for the proper sorting of the ClC-5 protein from the ER to the physiological destination site. To our knowledge, this study is the first that elucidates the diversity of the sorting disorder in the mutants related to Dent's disease using the same expression system comparatively.

paper_title.ja: 低K血症と高K血症の診断と治療の進め方
Diversity in the Sorting Disorder Induced by the Mutant CIC-5 Chloride Channels Responsible for Dent's Disease

description.en: A number of mutations in the CLCN5 gene have been demonstrated as causative genes linked to Dent's disease. However, the interrelation between cytoplasmic sorting and loss function of each CIC-5 mutant is still unclear. paper_title.en: Effective antibiotic treatment of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus-associated glomerulonephritis

description.en: Background. A new type of glomerulonephritis following a methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection has been reported. The purpose of this study is to elucidate the clinicopathological features and the responsiveness to treatment of the disease. Methods: We studied the treatment of 8 patients with glomerulonephritis related to MRSA infection. We observed the eight cases and analyzed clinical features, laboratory findings and histopathological data. Results: On admission, all patients had no renal abnormalities. One to four months after suffering from MRSA infection, severe proteinuria and hematuria developed. Renal biopsy specimens revealed moderate to severe mesangial proliferative glomerulonephritis with various degrees of crescent formation. Immunofluorescence studies showed IgA and C3. Antibiotic therapy was performed in six cases, resulting in successfully reducing the proteinuria in parallel with the decreased activity of MRSA infection in five cases. The other 2 cases received corticosteroid treatment after complete cessation of MRSA infection, but they had a relapse of MRSA infection and later died from sepsis. Conclusions: These results suggested that MRSA-associated glomerulonephritis might respond to antibiotic treatment in most cases. This also indicated that special care must be taken in the application of steroid therapy for the glomerulonephritis with crescents, even though the MRSA infection has gone into an inactive state. Copyright (C) 2002 S Karger AG, Basel.

description.en: Background. A new type of glomerulonephritis following a methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection has been reported. Methods: We studied the treatment of 8 patients with glomerulonephritis related to MRSA infection. This also indicated that special care must be taken in the application of steroid therapy for the glomerulonephritis with crescents, even though the MRSA infection has gone into an inactive state. paper_title.ja: －透析導入後の問題点－ 感染症
MPO-ANCA-Positive Slowly Progressive Glomerulonephritis with Focal Tuft Necrosis and Crescents

paper_title.en: MPO-ANCA-Positive Slowly Progressive Glomerulonephritis with Focal Tuft Necrosis and Crescents
Tubulointerstitial nephritis and uveitis syndrome with autoantibody directed to renal tubular cells

description.en: The pathogenesis of tubulointerstitial nephritis and uveitis (TINU) syndrome remains unknown, but T cell-mediated immune response has been postulated to play a role. On the other hand, TINU syndrome is characterized by hypergammaglobulinemia and high serum immunoglobulin G (IgG) levels, suggesting an involvement of humoral immunity. We describe a case of TINU syndrome in a 13-year-old girl with multiple tubular dysfunctions including renal glucosuria, tubular proteinuria, phosphaturia, uricosuria, and concentrating and acidifying defect. IgG antibody from her serum was reactive against 125-kDa human kidney protein. Immunofluorescence study using mouse kidney revealed that the antibody was against cortical renal tubular cells. The antibody disappeared as the renal symptoms resolved. We suggest that IgG antibody may contribute to tubular dysfunction in some patients with TINU syndrome.
